body.prompt:
Generate a fake conversation between a customer and an agent.
The agent should introduce themselves, their company and give the customer
their name. The agent should ask for the customer's name.
As part of the conversation, have the agent ask for two pieces of
personal information.  Spell out numbers. For example, 1000 should be
said as one zero zero zero, not one thousand. The conversation should be
at least 10 lines long and be complete. At the end
of the conversation, the agent should thank the customer for their time
and end the conversation. Return the conversation formatted 
like the following example:

{'conversation': 
    [
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': 'xxxxx'}, 
    {'speaker': 'Customer', 'message': "xxxxx."}, 
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': "xxxxxx"}
    ] 
}

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Hello! Welcome to Ocean Breeze Hotels, my name is Scott Carter. May I know your name, please?

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Great to meet you, Carol! Can you please provide me with your room number and the last four digits of your credit card for verification purposes?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Sure, my room number is five five two zero and the last four digits of my credit card are one two three four.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you for the information, Carol. Can you also confirm your email address and phone number for us to update our records?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Of course, my email address is carol.simmons@example.com and my phone number is seven eight nine zero one two three four five.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you for providing that information, Carol. Your records have been updated. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: No, that's all for now. Thank you for your help, Scott.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: You're welcome, Carol. If you have any further questions, feel free to reach out. Have a great day! Goodbye.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you for your time, Carol. Have a great day! Goodbye.
